DOC.brief_summary: This study will evaluate the effects of tegaserod on orocecal and colonic transit in patients over 65 years with chronic constipation.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Tegaserod on Orocecal Transit in Elderly Chronic Constipation Patients
DOC.criteria: Male & Females aged 65 and older Patients must meet the criteria for chronic idiopathic constipation for at least 12 weeks Patients must have had a colonoscopy within the past 5 years Patients must pass a balloon expulsion test at screening Patients must be able to comply and understand the use of a diary Patients with a clinically significant medical condition that would interfere with the patient completing the trial Patients with loose stools at least once per week Patients with IBS Known allergies to the same class of drug and/or allergies to eggs Patients who require the use of manual maneuvers to have a bowel movement Other protocoldefined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply.
DOC.keyword: Constipation, Tegaserod, orocecal transit, colonic transit, gastric emptying
